title: LME aluminium prices near USD 3091/t on 11 Feb 2026 as base metals pull back slightly
summary: LME aluminium prices eased 1.1% to around USD 3,091 per tonne amid broader base metals pressure from rising inventories and muted trading ahead of the Chinese Lunar New Year holiday. Copper stocks hit multi-month highs on LME, Shanghai Futures Exchange, and Comex. A stronger Chinese yuan provided some support by making dollar-priced metals more attractive to Chinese buyers.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,095.75 USD/T on February 13, down 0.05% from the prior day and 2.85% over the past month, though still 17.31% higher year-over-year. UK aluminum futures dropped to $3,050 per tonne from a three-year high, following reports of potential US tariff reductions on the metal previously doubled to 50%. Prices were last updated on February 14, 2026.

title: Trump to Roll Back Some Tariffs on Steel, Aluminum
summary: Aluminum prices sank to a one-week low after reports that Trump may trim import tariffs, with LME's three-month contract slipping over 1.18% to $3,063.50 a ton and Shanghai's most-active contract falling 1.76% to 23,195 yuan a ton. Trading slowed in China ahead of the Lunar New Year break from February 15 to 24. Copper prices also tumbled amid these pressures.

title: Tariffs: The Pedal Keeps Hitting the Metal | February 2026
summary: Since Trump's 50% tariff on aluminum in June, Midwest premiums and prices have risen monthly, with premiums from $0.40s to $1.04 and LME up $600 per tonne. A potential 25% tariff on imports from partners like Canada could add $0.35-0.37 per lb to US premiums. 2026 LME aluminum forecasts average around $3,250 per forecasts from analysts.

title: Chinese aluminium industry adjusts production amid high prices and holiday breaks
summary: China's aluminium sector is trimming output due to high prices, weak demand, and Lunar New Year breaks, with construction profile makers averaging 22-day stops and industrial extruders maintaining some operations for new energy orders. Secondary aluminium alloy firms face 8-20 day shutdowns, longer than last year, amid order weakness and environmental controls. Post-holiday, demand may recover in 'Golden March, Silver April' with price pullbacks expected to release held-back orders.

title: Trump Moves to Roll Back Metal & Aluminum Tariffs as Affordability Pressures Mount
summary: The Trump administration plans targeted easing of metal tariffs ahead of 2026 midterms to address affordability for voters and manufacturers. This follows earlier bolstering from Iran tensions but recent drops on deal prospects, weakening demand, and supply growth per IEA forecasts. Prices show slowing downside amid persistent oversupply concerns.

title: Aluminium drops on report Trump may ease tariffs
summary: Aluminium prices fell to a one-week low on reports of potential US tariff trims, with other industrial metals also declining. Trading volumes were low ahead of holidays, contributing to the price drop.

title: Chinese aluminium industry adjusts production amid high prices and holiday breaks
summary: China's aluminium sector is trimming output due to high prices exceeding CNY 20,000, weak demand, and order divergence during the 2026 Chinese New Year. Construction profile producers extended breaks averaging 22 days, while industrial extrusion producers maintained operations for new energy orders. Post-holiday, operating rates are expected to recover with seasonal demand and price pullbacks, though secondary aluminium alloy production faces prolonged shutdowns and weak orders.

title: Major Aluminum Project in Oklahoma Promises Thousands of Jobs
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium and Century Aluminum have partnered to build the first new primary aluminum smelter in the U.S. in nearly 50 years, located in Inola, Oklahoma. The facility will produce 750,000 metric tons annually, more than doubling current U.S. output, using advanced smelting technology. Construction starts late 2026, creating 1,000 permanent jobs and 4,000 construction jobs.

title: Trump to Roll Back Some Tariffs on Steel, Aluminum
summary: US President Trump plans to scale back some steel and aluminum tariffs due to concerns over rising consumer prices for goods like cans and pie tins. Aluminum prices dropped to a one-week low following the report, with trading slowed in China due to Lunar New Year closure. The administration will exempt certain items and pursue targeted security probes instead of broad expansions.

title: Trump plans to ease some steel, aluminum tariffs
summary: President Trump intends to reduce select steel and aluminum tariffs amid price pressures, causing shares of producers like Century Aluminum and Alcoa to decline. US officials note tariffs are raising costs for consumers on everyday goods. The review aims to exempt products and shift to specific national security investigations.

title: Aluminium drops on report Trump may ease tariffs
summary: Aluminum prices fell to a one-week low after reports of potential US tariff reductions on imports. The move is expected to ease global aluminum flows, though its impact on supply-demand balance is limited. Trading slowed in China due to the Lunar New Year holiday closure.

title: Sortera Raises $45 Million to Scale AI Driven Aluminum Upcycling
summary: Sortera has secured $45 million to expand its AI-enabled aluminum sorting platform and construct a second U.S. facility in Tennessee. The technology transforms mixed aluminum scrap into targeted alloys, reducing energy demand by up to 95% compared to virgin metal production and supporting low-carbon manufacturing goals. This aligns with U.S. priorities for reshoring materials and reducing foreign supply chain dependencies.

title: New GLAFRI President elected at Global Aluminium Foil Roller Conference 2026 in New Delhi
summary: Bruno Rea of Laminazione Sottile Group was elected as the new President of GLAFRI at the Global Aluminium Foil Roller Conference 2026 in New Delhi. He emphasized strengthening international cooperation, advancing sustainability solutions, and promoting aluminum foil for innovative applications. The leadership team also includes re-elected Vice President Simon Chan and new Vice President Krishna Kumar.

title: Registration Opens for the 21st ALUMINIUM CHINA - Driving the Non-Ferrous Metals Industry into a New Era
summary: Registration is open for ALUMINIUM CHINA 2026, focusing on cross-industry integration, intelligent manufacturing, and sustainable development amid global low-carbon transitions. The event highlights innovations in aluminum for new energy vehicles, low-altitude aviation, robotics, and lightweight materials. It features segmented halls for materials, equipment, and international technologies to enhance sourcing and collaboration.

title: Nucor Steel Price Moves: What the Latest CSP HRC Increase Signals for 2026 Buyers
summary: Nucor raised its CSP hot rolled coil (HRC) steel price to $975/ton for most mills and a specific rate at CSI for the week of February 9, 2026, marking the third consecutive weekly increase. U.S. HRC lead times have extended to the longest since last March due to outages and tight supply. Firmer prices, longer lead times, and constrained imports support higher steel levels, though sustaining them depends on demand improvement.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,056 CNY/T on February 13, 2026, up 0.53% from the previous day, though down 2.80% over the past month and 4.68% year-over-year. Recent news highlights steel rebar futures falling to a one-month low around CNY 3,070/ton on February 9 due to mills trimming production ahead of Lunar New Year. Earlier in February, prices pulled back from five-month highs amid declining industrial metals.

title: Taylor's Scrapyard and Metal Recycling Reports Steel Prices Continue Upward Trend in Early 2026
summary: Taylor's Scrapyard reports continued steel price rises in early 2026, building on January gains into February, following seasonal trends of strengthening demand from mills and manufacturing. This upward momentum creates opportunities for scrap metal sellers as consumption increases in construction and industrial sectors. The company offers metal recycling and demolition services in Georgia.

title: STEEL METAL RATE, NEWS & TREND - 12 FEB 2026
summary: Indian steel markets saw declines: MS ingot at 44,900, old scrap at 33,000, alloy scrap down 300 to 33,200; TMT prices fell 300/ton in Raipur, 500/ton in Mumbai. Ingot support at 44,700, resistance at 45,100. Global updates include 62% Fe fines CFR Qingdao below $102/ton, Tangshan billet stable at $420/ton on Feb 11, and Shagang holding rebar prices steady at $499/ton.

title: Construction steel prices: Tangshan (Feb 13, 2026 18:15)
summary: Mysteel reports construction steel prices in Tangshan, China, as collected by on-ground teams. This update provides the latest snapshot of regional pricing amid ongoing market fluctuations. Specific price details reflect current trading levels on February 13.

title: U.S. Steel Mill Output Rises in Early February - 2026-2-10
summary: U.S. raw steel output increased 4.9% year-over-year to 1.783 million net tons in the week ending February 7, 2026, with capability utilization rising to 77.1%. The Southern district led production with 800 thousand net tons, followed by the Great Lakes at 526 thousand net tons. Week-over-week production also strengthened, up 1.4% from the previous week.

title: Mid-February 2026 Steel Pipe Market: Navigating the Final Stretch of the Holiday Hiatus
summary: Steel pipe production remains idle but is expected to resume in a staggered manner from the week of February 23rd onwards, with full stable output anticipated by early March. The supply chain is preparing for reactivation, with initial post-holiday lead times potentially extending to 50-65 days as manufacturers clear significant order backlogs from before the holiday shutdown.

title: ArcelorMittal sees 2% rise in steel sales
summary: ArcelorMittal projects a 2% increase in global steel demand for 2026 (excluding China), with production and shipments expected to grow across all regions. European mills are anticipated to benefit from trade protections including the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) and new tariff rate quota mechanisms.

title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel industry
summary: Fujitsu has commenced a demonstration experiment on green steel value flow in the steel industry, selected by Japan's METI, running from December 2025 to February 2026. The project leverages blockchain and data platforms to securely distribute environmental value data, ensuring transaction confidentiality and preventing duplication across supply chains. It aims to accelerate decarbonization, promote DX in steel, and expand into a steel industry data space from 2026.

title: Latest News & Updates | ResponsibleSteel
summary: ResponsibleSteel reports progress in decarbonised steel markets, including hydrogen pilots, renewable energy integration, and circularity in India, while noting barriers like high green hydrogen costs. It announces landmark agreements with Europe’s Low Emission Steel Standard (LESS) and China’s C2F Steel, covering 60% of global steel production for standardized low-emission steel trade. These partnerships enable interoperability between standards to boost global comparability and decarbonization.

title: Slowing momentum and persistent barriers set up a critical year for green steel in 2026
summary: Global green steel momentum slowed in 2025 with only two new project announcements, down from 15 in 2021, and planned 2050 capacity at less than 2% of current production. 2026 features key milestones like Stegra’s Boden project in Sweden and pilots in Germany and the US, amid limited operational capacity. COP30 collaborations on certification standards could accelerate progress, but policy interventions are needed amid weak market conditions.

title: Copper Steadies as Lunar New Year Nears
summary: Copper rose to 5.80 USD/Lbs on February 13, 2026, up 0.30% from the previous day. Despite a 4.17% decline over the past month, copper remains 25.48% higher than a year ago. The price movement reflects support from ongoing supply disruptions and robust global demand, though near-term weakness is expected as economic activity in China slows ahead of Lunar New Year holidays.

title: Copper continues to decline after reaching a record high, as investors switch to risk-off positions
summary: Copper prices fell for the second consecutive session as investors adopted a risk-off stance following Kevin Warsh's nomination as Fed Chair. The benchmark copper contract on the London Metal Exchange dropped 2.73% to $12,798 per ton, while demand remained low as China prepared for Lunar New Year celebrations.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services announced a collaboration to source low-carbon copper produced through Nuton Technology, which uses naturally occurring microorganisms to extract copper from primary sulphide ores. The process eliminates traditional concentrators and smelters, reducing water use and emissions while producing 99.99 percent pure copper cathode at the mine gate. AWS will provide data and analytics expertise to optimize operations and accelerate verification across Nuton's production systems.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS announced a strategic partnership to deliver low-carbon Nuton copper for U.S. data center infrastructure. The collaboration combines industrial innovation with cloud technology to optimize acid and water use, improve copper recovery predictions, and reduce the time from concept to commercial deployment.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel fell to 16,995 USD/T on February 13, 2026, down 1.48% from the previous day, amid a monthly decline of 9.53% but up 9.96% year-over-year. Nickel futures surged to $17,900 per tonne in February after a speculative rally to a 19-month high of $18,785 earlier, driven by tight supply outlook. Indonesia announced a cut in nickel ore production quotas by over 100 million tonnes to 270 million in 2026.

title: Nickel Futures Rise from 1-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures rose to around $17,400 per tonne, rebounding from a one-month low of $17,000 earlier in February due to tightening global supply conditions. The increase was supported by supply concerns from Indonesia, the world’s largest nickel ore producer.

title: Nickel Market Eyes $20,000 as Supply Discipline Meets Surging ...
summary: The nickel market shows a constructive outlook in early 2026, backed by Indonesian supply discipline and strong demand. Prices have ranged $16,500-$18,500 per ton after peaking over $19,000 in January, with expectations of reaching $20,000 per ton soon as Indonesia caps 2026 ore production at 250-260 million tons.

title: Nickel Headed to $20,000 as Indonesia Limits Production, EV Demand Surges
summary: Nickel prices bounced between $16,500-$18,500/ton in January after exceeding $19,000, supported by Indonesia's flat-to-down 2026 ore production target of 250-260 million tons. EV demand grows at 20% annually, bolstering fundamentals toward $20,000+/ton prices amid supply discipline.

title: Nickel Prices Today
summary: Nickel prices plummeted on February 13, 2026, entering a correction phase after a recent speculative rally. The market reflects updated intraday data during active trading hours.

title: FLASH: ESDM approves nickel ore mining quotas up to 260-270 million tonnes for 2026
summary: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) announced the 2026 Nickel Work Plan and Budget with an approved production quota of 260-270 million tonnes. Director General Tri Winarno revealed this target at a media address in Jakarta, aligning with earlier disclosures by the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association.

title: Nickel Headed to $20,000 as Indonesia Limits Production, EV Demand Surges
summary: Nickel prices bounced between $16,500-$18,500 per ton in January as Indonesia committed to flat-to-down ore production targets of 250-260 million tons for 2026. The analysis projects nickel could move toward $20,000 per ton within the next month as production discipline is verified, supported by robust 20% EV demand growth.

title: Nickel Futures Rise from 1-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures surged to $17,900 per tonne in February after Indonesia confirmed it will cut mining permits to 260 million wet tons in 2026, down from 379 million tons in 2025. The reduction signals tighter availability of nickel feedstock for stainless steel and battery production, with enforcement actions against illegal mining adding to supply uncertainty.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Asian nickel market faces Q1 pressure as oversupply outweighs output cuts
summary: Despite Indonesia's efforts to control mining output, the Asian nickel market is expected to remain under pressure in Q1 2026. S&P Global projects the nickel market will remain in surplus by 179,000 metric tons through 2026, with supply uncertainty intensified by Vale Indonesia's temporary halt of mining operations due to delayed work plan approval.

title: 【SMM Analysis】Indonesian Nickel Initial Outlook in 2026: Navigating the RKAB Quota Crunch
summary: Indonesia's ESDM adjusted the 2026 RKAB production quotas to 260-270 million wmt, slightly higher than earlier signals of 250-260 million wmt. The analysis indicates 2026 will be a difficult year for miners with the downstream smelter pipeline looking increasingly vulnerable due to tight supply conditions.

title: Indonesia to cut nickel mining quota in 2026
summary: Indonesia's ESDM will cut the 2026 nickel production quota to 260-270 million tonnes, representing a significant reduction from the 2025 approved quota of 379 million tonnes. The reduced quota falls substantially below the estimated 330 million tonnes of Indonesian nickel ore consumption for 2026, creating potential supply shortfalls.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority has initiated an investigation into major low-voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl, for alleged price-fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted yesterday at company offices, distributors, and the National Federation of Electrical Material Wholesalers, supported by Guardia di Finanza. Prysmian shares dropped 1.26% in response, though analysts view the impact as negligible given the small market share.
